documentation.path: Path to the file. When a rolling interval is specified, the name will be appended automatically.
documentation.outputTemplate: A message template describing the format used to write to the sink. the default is '{Timestamp:yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.fff zzz} [{Level:u3}] {Message:lj}{NewLine}{Exception}'
documentation.fileSizeLimitBytes: The approximate maximum size, in bytes, to which a log file will be allowed to grow. For unrestricted growth, pass null. The default is 1 GB if not specified. To avoid writing partial events, the last event within the limit will be written in full even if it exceeds the limit.
documentation.restrictedToMinimumLevel: The minimum level for events passed through the sink. Options: Verbose | Debug | Information | Warning | Error | Fatal
documentation.retainedFileCountLimit: The maximum number of log files that will be retained, including the current log file. For unlimited retention, pass null. For example, when rollingInterval = Hour, 744 (= 24 * 31) equals one month
documentation.rollingInterval: The interval at which logging will roll over to a new file, defaults to Infinite if not specified. Options: Infinite, Year, Month, Day, Hour, Minute. Each option, except Infinite, will append something to the filename. For example, Day will create files named '...yyyyMMdd.log'
documentation.rollOnFileSizeLimit: If true, a new file will be created when the file size limit is reached. Filenames will have a number appended in the format _NNN, with the first filename given no number.
